case_name: Appeal under s. 88.33 (9) of the Municipal Elections Act, 1996
legal_issues: Whether the Election Compliance Audit Committee (ECAC) erred in not ordering a compliance audit due to financial reporting errors on Form 4
outcome_details: The court found that the ECAC was in error in not ordering a compliance audit. The court ordered a compliance audit and directed the ECAC to appoint an auditor.
decision_factors: Mathematical error in the financial statement (Form 4)
Role of the Audit Committee in screening requests
De minimus reporting error can trigger audit obligation
summary: The court dealt with an appeal concerning the refusal of the Election Compliance Audit Committee (ECAC) to order a compliance audit, despite a financial reporting error by a candidate. The court held that even minor errors are sufficient to warrant an audit to ensure transparency and accountability in municipal elections. Therefore, the court ordered a compliance audit to be conducted by the ECAC.
